intro: Tithymalus characias, commonly known as the alpine thyme or mountain thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. This plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it is often used in ornamental gardening for its hardy nature and pleasant fragrance. Tithymalus characias is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
